Deep in the shadowy recesses of the searing eye the dark presence of
Vorpal lurked. Malevolent and dark he brooded as his clawed finger
tapped casually on the metal armrest of his throne. In front of him
several view screens sat depicting the scene of a battle before him,
the figures easily recognizable to anyone who had been watching up to
this point: Azureblade and Animus. To the side of the screen numbers
and graphs depicted the energy readings and power fluxuations that were
being detected.

�Interesting.� Came the deep almost metallic sounds of Vorpal�s voice.
�Do you have all that you require Krytek.� Vorpal turned ever so
slightly to take in the tall and some might even say imposing form
standing off to the side.

Sitting at a console, the deep shadows of this chamber masks many of
Krytek�s features, only the lights from his faceplate are visible as
they blink on and off. �Negative.� Krytek�s voice is cold as he speaks,
�However the scans are nearly complete. The X4 unit is operating within
its design specification, but it was not originally manufactured for
this purpose.� Krytek depressed a few more keys on his console, �It is
also unlikely that Animus will survive long enough to complete our
tests. He will require assistance.�

Vorpal�s clawed fingers stilled their tapping for a moment as the
unicronian general paused thoughtfully. �Perhaps this intruder could
use a bit more ... stimulus.� His voice displayed just the slightest
touch of humor. �Begin phase 2.�

�Understood.� Krytek responded simply as he turned to his console, 
quickly weapon system displays were brought up ... 

Somewhere above them, on the surface of the moon a single missile
launcher rose from a hidden location, turned to orient on some fixed
point and abruptly launched a rather large missile into the faint
atmosphere of the moon. The missile quickly flared, shot forward and
within moments is gone from sight, even as the missile launcher itself
began lowering itself out of view.

(See more after Nic's Insert)

--- Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:

> Azureblade was caught by the blinding beam, but he stayed calm as his
> sword and Animus`s locked together.
> 
> Azureblade: Now, you die.
> 
> His jammed optics eerily sought out Animus's face and the predatory
> grin slowly turned into a savage laugh.
> 
> Unexpectedly, the attack started elsewhere than where Animus was
> looking. It came right at the center of his spark. Slowly, the
> Protoform Z part of Azureblade was trying to tear its way into the
> Minion's very spark.
> 
> AzureBlade: My legacy... Protoform X could feed off fear inside a
> spark... He was botched... I will rip out your very mind!

Animus stepped back and stumbled as fear ripped over him like claws. He
struggled to hold off Azure's attack, even as his arms weakened in
fear! Then suddenly like a beacon of light a rather large missile rose
over the lunar horizon, and for a moment a smile spread across Animus'
face as he fell back, and rather than readying himself for death, he
began to laugh!
 
The missile on the other hand rather than targeting Azure, crashed on
the moon's rocky surface, and rather than exploding, a large cargo
sized door opened outward. Out of the door poured dozens of small
Carmine red spheres, roughly half the size of a transformer�s head.
They floated in the air as if orienting on prey and then as if on some
cue they began flying at Azure, attempting to attach themselves to his
armor!

Animus tried to back away from Azure ...

Preston
(Da�minion)
